bibl.title: Letter from Lord Dawson to Philip Showalter Hench, February 13, 1937

div1.p: Dawson writes that he will be unable to visit the United States next autumn.

div1.head: Letter from Lord Dawson to Philip Showalter Hench, February 13, 1937
div1.p:
It was good to hear from you again, but as
you will see from the enclosed copy of a letter(Enc. 1) I have
sent to Dr Hutchinson, it is impossible for me to leave
England next autumn.

I would love to see you all again, and the
next time I get an opportunity I mean to come to the States.
I always profit in knowledge and happiness when visiting
the other side of the Atlantic and I hope it will not be
long before I will be free to do so again.

It was very good of you to send me your reprints
and I will read them with both interest and pleasure.

Sybil is married and has three children, the
youngest being one month old.

Kindest regards from us all to you and your
wife.
